sentence.text: X-linked hearing impairment is the rarest form of genetic hearing loss (HL) and represents only a positive regulation of glucose transmembrane transport fraction of all cases.

entity.text: positive regulation of glucose transmembrane transport

sentence.text: Subpopulation screening of the coding exons and flanking introns of striated muscle contraction was further performed for 338 Chinese patients with nonsydromic HL by Sanger sequencing, and another two potential causative substitutions (c.238C>A and c.55A>G) in SMPX were identified in additional sporadic cases of congenital deafness.

Collectively, this study is the first to report the role of striated muscle contraction in Chinese population and identify a novel frameshift mutation in SMPX that causes not only nonsyndromic late-onset progressive HL, but also congenital hearing impairment.
